paper_metadata.title: Key performance indicators for assessing inherent energy performance of machine tools in industries
paper_metadata.publication_date: 2018-08-13 (published online); 2019 (Intl. J. Production Research, Vol.57 No.6)

machine_info.machine_type: CNC milling centre (case study) / general machine tools (framework applies to milling, turning, drilling, grinding)
machine_info.material_processed: Aluminium plate (case study: Al plate 200 mm × 250 mm × 30 mm); framework-level: various (steel, aluminum, titanium, cast irons, composites)

feed_power_functions_W.note: paper reports feed-power as fitted linear functions (X and Y axes). Z-axis not measured (low power/variability).

measurement_notes.power_analyser: HC3390 power analyser, sampling frequency 500 kHz
measurement_notes.force_measurement: force sensor + charge amplifier + data acquisition used to measure cutting forces (for cutting power/loading loss)
measurement_notes.measurement_boundary: Type 1 (electrical energy at mains) per ISO conventions
measurement_notes.measurement_steps_constraints: dwell time of 5 s between steps; idling time T2 > 5 s; air-cutting distance > 20 mm recommended

constant_and_variable_examples_W.note: Spindle power P_spindle is computed by subtracting standby power (415 W used in example) from measured idling power shown in idling-power curves.

power_consumption.measurement_method: Direct experimental measurement: HC3390 power analyser (500 kHz), force sensor + charge amplifier + DAQ for cutting forces; data acquisition for variable power; measurement boundary = electrical input (Type 1).

kpi_metrics.efficiency: Framework-focused: IEP indexes decompose machine energy into standby, starting, idling, feed, and additional loading loss; efficiency improvements are expressed via reduced equivalent indexes or lower loading-loss coefficients rather than a single universal % in the paper.

selection_example_table_5.note: Table 5 shows how proposed IEP indexes change ranking/selection compared to conventional metric.

additional_notes: This paper proposes the IEP index system and demonstrates its extraction via a CNC milling-centre case study. The JSON captures the numeric functions, coefficients and equivalent-index values reported in Table 4 and related text. Limitations reported by the authors: indexes primarily suitable for metal-cutting machine tools; OCD (operation-correlated data) in the case study was collected from a single enterprise (may be statistically limited). If you want, I can: (A) convert the idling-power piecewise functions into a numeric table at the nine representative rpms, (B) compute spindle power estimates at the representative rpms by subtracting standby and present them in spindle_data array, and (C) split the full PDF into 1000–2000 word chunks and extract any additional numeric tables/figures into arrays — tell me which of A/B/C you prefer and I will produce the expanded JSON immediately.
